elements.title: What were the epistemic goals of the paper? (check all that apply)
elements.info: These categories are from Scheel, Muijlwijk, & Lakens (in prep.).

elements.title: Empirical phenomena (establish ‘what exists’ and consolidate stable patterns in data)
elements.info:
Empirical phenomena: Establish ‘what exists’ and consolidate stable patterns in data.
  • { $EG_Empirical_Inventorizing | Inventorizing: Creating a comprehensive database or inventory of a phenomenon to facilitate future research. }
  • { $EG_Empirical_Process | Process or underlying structure: Investigating a process or underlying structure of some higher-level phenomenon. }
  • { $EG_Empirical_Estimation | Estimation: Estimating the strength of relationships between different concepts. }
  • { $EG_Empirical_GeneralityBoundary | Generality/boundary conditions: Investigating whether a previously observed phenomenon is present in a new context or population. }
  • { $EG_Empirical_PhenomenaConfirmation | Phenomena Confirmation: Verifying the existence of a previously observed phenomenon. }

elements.title: Concept development (abstract from data and aim to find useful descriptive models and concepts)
elements.info:
• { $EG_ConceptDevelopment_ConceptRevision | Concept Revision: Investigating whether an existing concept could be improved in a certain way. }
  • { $EG_ConceptDevelopment_DescriptiveModelling | Descriptive Modelling: Representing data patterns by means of a (statistical or conceptual) model. A central motivation of descriptive models is to reduce complexity and make data patterns easier to grasp. }

elements.title: Theory (focus on a theoretical model rather than on explaining one specific phenomenon)

options.text: Theory affirmation: Can we find evidence for the theory? (Not falsification)

elements.info: Theory: Focus on a theoretical model (i.e., a framework with the purpose of explaining multiple phenomena) rather than on explaining one specific phenomenon.

elements.title: Other

options.text: Causal explanation for a single empirical phenomenon
Application ('Make it work' - an engineering perspective)

elements.info:
• { $EG_Other_MeasurementAuxiliaries | Measurement & auxiliaries: Examine methodological factors that are necessary auxiliaries to answering substantive research questions }
  • { $EG_Other_CausalExplanation | Causal explanation: Answer ‘why’ questions and establish explanations for single empirical phenomena (if you investigate a broader theoretical framework that aims to explain multiple phenomena, check one or more items in the Theory section above. }
  • { $EG_Other_Application | Application: Focus on real-world interventions and aim to influence an outcome in a natural setting }
